name: Database Management Systems

topics.description: This topic introduces the fundamentals of relational database theory, including concepts like entities, attributes, relationships, and keys. You'll learn about different types of database models and understand how to design a relational database schema using normalization techniques.  This knowledge is essential for building well-structured and efficient databases.
references: Codd, E. F. (1970). A relational model of data for large shared data banks. ACM Transactions on Database Systems, 5(1), 37-57.
Elmasri, R., & Navathe, S. B. (2016). Fundamentals of database systems (7th ed.). Pearson Education.

topics.description: This topic focuses on SQL, the standard language for interacting with relational databases. You'll learn how to write SELECT statements to retrieve data, INSERT statements to add new records, UPDATE statements to modify existing data, and DELETE statements to remove data. You'll also explore various clauses and operators to filter, sort, and aggregate data effectively. Proficiency in SQL is crucial for managing and querying databases.

This topic delves into data manipulation and transaction management in relational databases. You'll learn how to handle data integrity constraints, perform bulk data operations, and understand the concept of ACID properties (Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability) for ensuring reliable transactions. This knowledge is essential for maintaining data accuracy and consistency in a database system.

This topic covers fundamental database administration tasks, including user management, security controls, and backup and recovery procedures. You'll learn how to create user accounts, assign permissions, implement security measures to protect sensitive data, and establish procedures for backing up and restoring database systems. These skills are crucial for ensuring the security, integrity, and availability of databases.
references: Securing Your Database: A Comprehensive Guide

description: Explore relational database concepts, SQL querying, data manipulation, and database administration.
aims: Understand relational database theory and normalization.
Write SQL queries for data retrieval, insertion, update, and deletion.
Manage database users, permissions, and security.
Implement basic database backups and recovery procedures.
